page.title: 04RELIGION, COLD ASHTON AREA.
page.content: The focal point is the{Anglican parish{church}of Cold Ashton, dedicated to the Holy Trinity. There are about 30 on the electoral roll and an average attendance of about 15. The{Vicar}is domiciled in Marshfield and there is one{service each Sunday. This is either a morning service of Holy Communion or Matins or an afternoon service of Evensong. Once monthly this is a family service instead. The Church dates back to early 16th century. The tower is probably 200 years older and contains 2 bells. Two glass cases contain interesting items. One is a volume of the original Authorised version of the Bible (1611) and the other a handwritten {history}of the Church. The Church plate dates back to the 15th and 16th century.
